metadata.title: USN-4710-1 -- Linux kernel vulnerability
metadata.description: Kiyin (尹亮) discovered that the perf subsystem in the Linux kernel did not properly deallocate memory in some situations. A privileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (kernel memory exhaustion).  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-4710-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-image-4.15.0-135-lowlatency - 4.15.0-135.139 linux-image-4.15.0-135-generic - 4.15.0-135.139 linux-image-4.15.0-135-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-135.139 No subscription required  linux-image-lowlatency-hwe-16.04 - 4.15.0.135.122 linux-image-virtual-hwe-16.04 - 4.15.0.135.122 linux-image-generic-lpae-hwe-16.04-edge - 4.15.0.135.122 linux-image-generic - 4.15.0.135.122 linux-image-virtual-hwe-16.04-edge - 4.15.0.135.122 linux-image-lowlatency-hwe-16.04-edge - 4.15.0.135.122 linux-image-lowlatency - 4.15.0.135.122 linux-image-generic-hwe-16.04 - 4.15.0.135.122 linux-image-virtual - 4.15.0.135.122 linux-image-generic-hwe-16.04-edge - 4.15.0.135.122 linux-image-generic-lpae - 4.15.0.135.122 linux-image-generic-lpae-hwe-16.04 - 4.15.0.135.122 No subscription required
